content:
Sure, here are some basic rules for "Chronicles of Everia" that utilize 10-sided dice:

1. Character Creation:
	* Roll 3d10 six times and record each result.
	* Assign each result to a different attribute: Strength, Dexterity, Constitution, Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma.
	* Choose a race and class for your character, each of which will provide additional bonuses and abilities.
2. Combat:
	* Determine initiative by rolling a d10 and adding your Dexterity modifier.
	* To make an attack, roll a d10 and add your Attack bonus. If the result equals or exceeds the target's Armor Class, the attack hits.
	* Roll damage by rolling the appropriate dice for your weapon or spell, and adding any relevant modifiers.
3. Skill Checks:
	* When attempting a skill check, roll a d10 and add the relevant attribute modifier and any relevant bonuses.
	* If the result equals or exceeds the difficulty class set by the Game Master, the check is successful.
4. Magic:
	* To cast a spell, roll a d10 and add your Spellcasting bonus.
	* The difficulty class for an opponent to resist your spell is equal to 8 + your Spellcasting modifier + the level of the spell.
5. Experience and Leveling Up:
	* Experience is awarded for defeating enemies, completing quests, and achieving other goals as determined by the Game Master.
	* When you earn enough experience, you gain a level, which provides additional abilities and bonuses.

Of course, these are just very basic rules, and many other rules and mechanics could be added to make the game more complex and interesting.
